verses.plain: I am the rose of Sharon, and the lily of the valleys.

tokens.t: I
the rose of Sharon,
the lily of the valleys.

verses.plain: As the lily among thorns, so is my love among the daughters.

tokens.t: As the lily among thorns, so
my love among the daughters.

verses.plain: As the apple tree among the trees of the wood, so is my beloved among the sons. I sat down under his shadow with great delight, and his fruit was sweet to my taste.

tokens.t: As the apple tree among the trees of the wood, so
my beloved among the sons. I sat down under his shadow with great delight, and his fruit
sweet to my taste.

verses.plain: He brought me to the banqueting house, and his banner over me was love.

tokens.t: He brought me to the banqueting house, and his banner over me
love.

verses.plain: Stay me with flagons, comfort me with apples: for I am sick of love.

tokens.t: Stay me with flagons, comfort me with apples: for I
sick of love.

verses.plain: His left hand is under my head, and his right hand doth embrace me.

tokens.t: His left hand
under my head, and his right hand doth embrace me.

verses.plain: I charge you, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, by the roes, and by the hinds of the field, that ye stir not up, nor awake my love, till he please.

tokens.t: I charge you, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, by the roes, and by the hinds of the field, that ye stir not up, nor awake
love, till he please.

verses.plain: ¶ The voice of my beloved! behold, he cometh leaping upon the mountains, skipping upon the hills.

tokens.t: ¶ The voice of my beloved! behold, he cometh leaping upon the mountains, skipping upon the hills.

verses.plain: My beloved is like a roe or a young hart: behold, he standeth behind our wall, he looketh forth at the windows, shewing himself through the lattice.

tokens.t: My beloved is like a roe or a young hart: behold, he standeth behind our wall, he looketh forth at the windows, shewing himself through the lattice.

verses.plain: My beloved spake, and said unto me, Rise up, my love, my fair one, and come away.

tokens.t: My beloved spake, and said unto me, Rise up, my love, my fair one, and come away.

verses.plain: For, lo, the winter is past, the rain is over and gone;

tokens.t: For, lo, the winter is past, the rain is over
gone;

verses.plain: The flowers appear on the earth; the time of the singing of birds is come, and the voice of the turtle is heard in our land;

tokens.t: The flowers appear on the earth; the time of the singing
is come, and the voice of the turtle is heard in our land;

verses.plain: The fig tree putteth forth her green figs, and the vines with the tender grape give a good smell. Arise, my love, my fair one, and come away.

tokens.t: The fig tree putteth forth her green figs, and the vines
the tender grape give a
smell. Arise, my love, my fair one, and come away.

verses.plain: ¶ O my dove, that art in the clefts of the rock, in the secret places of the stairs, let me see thy countenance, let me hear thy voice; for sweet is thy voice, and thy countenance is comely.

tokens.t: ¶ O my dove,
in the clefts of the rock, in the secret
of the stairs, let me see thy countenance, let me hear thy voice; for sweet
thy voice, and thy countenance
comely.

verses.plain: Take us the foxes, the little foxes, that spoil the vines: for our vines have tender grapes.

tokens.t: Take us the foxes, the little foxes, that spoil the vines: for our vines
tender grapes.

verses.plain: ¶ My beloved is mine, and I am his: he feedeth among the lilies.

tokens.t: ¶ My beloved
mine, and I
his: he feedeth among the lilies.

verses.plain: Until the day break, and the shadows flee away, turn, my beloved, and be thou like a roe or a young hart upon the mountains of Bether.

tokens.t: Until the day break, and the shadows flee away, turn, my beloved, and be thou like a roe or a young hart upon the mountains of Bether.

footnotes.text: I sat…: Heb. I delighted and sat down, etc
comfort…: Heb. straw me with apples
I charge…: Heb. I adjure you
